Labour and birth
101
any doubt, don’t hesitate to 
contact your midwife.
Regular contractions 
During a contraction, your 
uterus gets tight and then 
relaxes. You may have had 
these throughout your 
pregnancy	–	particularly	
towards the end. Before 
labour, these are called 
Braxton Hicks contractions. 
When you are having regular 
contractions that last more 
than 30 seconds and begin to 
feel stronger, labour may have 
started. Your contractions will 
bec
